4/ If there will be a DAO around a news publication, allowing readers and writers to own the media. Would you join? üòè

3/ TestingCatalog was built on public and the same will remain with its DAO. I am not going to be announcing everything at once but rather adding posts over here one by one. It is important for me to kick off this topic so I can start pushing it forward.

2/ TestingCatalog is an old project with a long evolutionary history and now it turns into a new chapter. 

I am planning a gradual DAO exit - to become one of the first news publications owned by its authors and readers. This is the way üõ∏

1/ If you wonder what's going on here - I have 30-120 free minutes a day that I spend building a web3 news publishing website. 

It's covering new features on apps and tools that you use every day as well as early access experiences.

Testing web2 vs testing web3

#web2 - endless A/B tests, gradual rollouts, meaningless alpha/beta programs, no testing communities.

#web3 - early accesses, everything is alpha, whitelists, most projects are community-first.

Which one would you prefer? üòè
#Web2vsWeb3me
